meanings.definition: Established or introduced (a system, policy, or practice)
meanings.sent1: The school instituted a new rule for recess time.
meanings.sent2: The government instituted a new tax law last year.
meanings.sent3: The cat instituted a 'no dogs allowed' policy in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The sun instituted a daily routine of rising and setting.
meanings.sent5: The chef instituted a strict cleanliness policy in the kitchen.

meanings.definition: Brought into existence or set in motion
meanings.sent1: The mayor instituted a city-wide cleanup campaign.
meanings.sent2: The scientist instituted a groundbreaking research project.
meanings.sent3: The clown instituted a new dance move that had everyone laughing.
meanings.sent4: The wind instituted a whirlwind of change in the small town.
meanings.sent5: The teacher instituted a fun learning game in the classroom.

meanings.definition: Appointed or assigned to a position or role
meanings.sent1: The newly instituted manager quickly gained the team's respect.
meanings.sent2: The instituted leader guided the group with wisdom and care.
meanings.sent3: The instituted captain of the ship had a parrot as a first mate.
meanings.sent4: The instituted queen of the forest ruled with grace and strength.
meanings.sent5: The instituted president of the club organized a successful event.
